member.name: T:System.Data.OleDb.PropVariantUnion
member.summary: Union portion of PROPVARIANT
member.remarks: All fields (or their placeholders) are declared even if they are not used. This is to make sure that the size of the union matches the size of the union in the actual unmanaged PROPVARIANT structure for all architectures (32-bit/64-bit). Points to note: - All pointer type fields are declared as IntPtr. - CAxxx type fields (like CAC, CAUB, etc.) are all of same structural layout, hence not all declared individually since they are not used. A placeholder CArray is used to represent all of them to account for the size of these types. CArray is defined later. - Rest of the fields are declared with corresponding managed equivalent types.

member.name: P:System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal.UnbindOnTransactionCompletion
member.summary: Get boolean that specifies whether an enlisted transaction can be unbound from the connection when that transaction completes.
member.value: True if the enlisted transaction can be unbound on transaction completion; otherwise false.

member.name: M:System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal.DoomThisConnection
member.devdoc: Ensure that this connection cannot be put back into the pool.

member.name: M:System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal.TryOpenConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionFactory,System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCompletionSource{System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal},System.Data.Common.DbConnectionOptions)
member.devdoc: The default implementation is for the open connection objects, and it simply throws. Our private closed-state connection objects override this and do the correct thing.

member.name: M:System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal.IsConnectionAlive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, will check if the underlying connection is still actually alive
member.param: If true an exception will be thrown if the connection is dead instead of returning true\false (this allows the caller to have the real reason that the connection is not alive (e.g. network error, etc))
member.returns: True if the connection is still alive, otherwise false (If not overridden, then always true)

member.name: M:System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionPool.ReplaceConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Data.Common.DbConnectionOptions,System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal)
member.summary: Creates a new connection to replace an existing connection
member.param: Options used to create the new connection
Inner connection that will be replaced
member.returns: A new inner connection that is attached to the
